instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
Hey another A1502 board for repair.

The board came in with not booting up and saw corrosion around U7501 with Pin 12 without a track which I made a jumper to pin 1 of R8140 and also replaced U7501. Unfortunately it hasn't made any changes and I also didn't take a complete list of the voltages I was getting before attempting the repair so I've only got the measurements after the repairs.

The CPU is getting warm and I've check all the traces and rails but don't see anything else wrong with the board. Hopefully someone can advise what I could check on next.

 			[TD="width: 147"]1.150V[/TD]

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
Post resistance to ground on all these rails:
PPBUS_G3H, PP5V_S5, PP3V3_S5.
Check allso if you have short between PPBUS_G3H and any big coil from secondary supplies...

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: This does not sound good! PPBUS is low and CPU is getting warm. I suspect PPBUS is shorted to some secondary rail. Probably RIP.

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H is 60Ohms
PP5V_S5 constantly going up towards infinity.
PP3V3_S5 around 0.483 KOhms 

Short can only be seen when put between PPBUS_G3H and L7130

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
L7130 is on PPBUS_G3H line; check with other coils...
Any other big coil shows 50-60 ohms to ground?

Remove F7140 and see where the low value remains.

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
okay somehow I find that L7520 is actually showing short with PPBUS_G3H aswell.

ANd no some coils are showing 80 Ohms and some are showing way above that L7520 is showing around 2-5 Ohms.

I'll double check the situation with the fuse tomorrow.

Appreciate any help, thanks.

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
"I find that L7520 is actually showing short with PPBUS_G3H"
So Q7520 is shorted...

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
Pin 6/7/8 is showing short even with the IC taken off

EDIT: above mesaurements with regards to Q7520

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
As per schematic, pins 6/7/8 are tied together.
Q7520 is shorted 1-6, that is the problem...

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: so replace the component?

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
trying to check every component on the lines but removing the capacitors still showing the P5VS4 rail as short.

Any component in particular do you reckon i should check out?

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
Checked if U7501 is shorting the rail, but that seems like its shorting it even with that chip removed.

Removing F7140 I can see that Pin 2 is showing the 60Ohms (low resistance value)

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: That seems like a short on pin 2 of PPBUS...inject voltage to see what heats up. Start low at 1 volt in case it's the CPU.

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: I am getting 1.150V roughly on PPBUS_G3H so should I start higher say 2V?

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: You didn't remove Q7520 yet???

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: I still have it removed

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
So you have 60 ohms at PPBUS_G3H?
Any secondary power rail (big coils) with same value?
If only L7520, then remove U7501 and check again.
Do NOT power up the board without U7501...

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: only L7520 showing 60 ohms and with U7501 removed it is still showing 60 Ohms

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: Yeah, but what shows PPBUS_G3H without U7501?

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
without U7501 attached PPBUS_G3H is still showing 60 Ohms

Every other coil is showing the same or similar resistances when put against PPBUS_G3H

With Q7520 also removed it doesn't show any significant changes and no coils showing the same resistances as PPBUS_G3H (which is showing 35Ohms)

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
"PPBUS_G3H is still showing 60 Ohms"
---
"showing the same resistances as PPBUS_G3H (which is showing 35Ohms)"
Can you clarify the things please...
Also post resistance between PPBUS_G3H and L7520 too.

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
Okay my multimeter must've glitched on me, disregard that bit - "showing the same resistances as PPBUS_G3H (which is showing 35Ohms)"

The resistance values between PPBUS_G3H and L7520 is 60 Ohms

Taking a reading with PPBUS_G3H to ground is also showing 60 Ohms
When taking a resistance value from L7520 to ground it is showing 2 Ohms

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
So you have the sort to ground on L7520.
Only 2 ohms will allow you find the culprit injecting voltage there.
Be aware, do not overtake 5.5V and keep ampers below power lab supply limit.
Start with 2V, that should mean 2W dispation and increase until get a hot element.
4-5W should be easy detected with the finger...

Remember, do NOT power up the board before resolder U7501.

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
should i remove L7520 before injecting the voltage or do it with the coil attached? 

Many thanks for everything!

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: No matters L7520, just remove the burnt Q7520...

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
Shorted chips Q7630 and U7600 removed both and the shorts where gone from everywhere and resistance values normalised.

Replaced the chips (including Q7520) and short still gone. (blessed), made sure everything was still good and then plugged it in.

PPBUS was showing 12.6 Volts for awhile then dropped back to 1.150V.

L7520 and the whole rail isnt showing short anymore to ground or when checked between the coil and PPBUS_G3H 

But PPBUS_G3H is showing short to ground and also showing short with L7560 (PP3V3_S5)

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message: Did you put back U7501?

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
Yeah I did I put a new U7501, Q7520, Q7630 and U7600.

Many thanks.

threads.title: 820-3476 Board gets warm, no fan spinning, not booting up, Corrosion around U7501
threads.message:
I hope you didn't power up the board without U7501 in any moment.
That is a good reason short U7560.

As you was able to eliminate the low values on 5V rail, you can do the same on 3.3V.
Be aware, this time PCH, or SMC could be burnt...
